mc_autofisher.screengrabber module¶

Tkinter application that allows the user to select a rectangular portion of their screen using the grab() function, which will be returned as a coordinate tuple. If run as a script, the coordinates will be written to a JSON config file, default file is out.txt but a different name can be passed in on the command line.

mc_autofisher.screengrabber.grab()[source]¶

Opens a Tkinter window and allows the user to click and drag a rectangular selection, then returns the coordinates of the selection
